inventory_management.description: An inventory and order management system that tracks items, suppliers, purchase orders, and customer orders.

tables.description: Stores user information for system access, including roles like 'admin' and 'user'.

columns.description: Unique identifier for the user.
The name of the user.
The role of the user, either 'admin' or 'user'.
The user's unique email address.
The user's hashed password for security.

tables.description: Contains information about suppliers who provide items.

columns.description: Unique identifier for the supplier.
The name of the supplier.
A brief description of the supplier.
The supplier's email address.
The supplier's contact phone number.

tables.description: Stores details about all items in the inventory, including raw materials and final products.

columns.description: Unique identifier for the item.
Unique Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) for the item.
The type or category of the item.
The name of the item.
Specific variant of the item (e.g., color, size).
Current quantity of the item in stock.
The minimum quantity that should be in stock before reordering.

tables.description: A linking table that maps which items are supplied by which suppliers.

columns.description: Unique identifier for the supplier-item link.
Foreign key referencing the 'item' table.
Foreign key referencing the 'supplier' table.
The supplier's specific SKU for the item.

tables.description: Defines the Bill of Materials (BOM) for complex items. It lists the child items (components) required to assemble a parent item.

columns.description: The assembled product (parent item).
The component (child item) needed for the assembly.
The quantity of the child item required to make one parent item.

tables.description: Contains header information for purchase orders made to suppliers.

columns.description: Unique identifier for the purchase order.
The supplier the order was sent to.
The user who created the purchase order.
The date and time the purchase order was created.
The current status of the purchase order (e.g., 'pending', 'completed').

tables.description: Contains the line items for each purchase order, detailing which items were ordered and in what quantity.

columns.description: Foreign key referencing the 'purchase_order' table.
The item being ordered.
The quantity of the item ordered.
Reference to the specific supplier-item link.
Unique identifier for the customer order.
The order ID from Shopify, if applicable.
The date the customer placed the order.
The current status of the customer order (e.g., 'unfulfilled', 'fulfilled').
The name of the customer.
The customer's contact number.
The customer's street address.
The customer's unit number.
The customer's postal code.

tables.description: Contains the line items for each customer order, detailing the specific products, quantities, and delivery information.

columns.description: Foreign key referencing the 'order' table.
The item that was ordered.
The quantity of the item requested by the customer.
The scheduled delivery date for the item.
The monetary value of this line item.

tables.description: Stores items that a user has added to their cart before creating a purchase order.

columns.description: Unique identifier for the cart item entry.
The user who owns the cart.
The item in the cart.
The quantity of the item in the cart.
